H0.text: under the federal unemployment tax act which party pays unemployment taxes. Employees

H1.text: under the federal unemployment tax act which party pays unemployment taxes. State Governments

H2.text: under the federal unemployment tax act which party pays unemployment taxes. The Federal Government

H3.text: under the federal unemployment tax act which party pays unemployment taxes. Employers

A4.text: Employers report this tax by filing Internal Revenue Service Form 940 annually.

A5.text: The Federal Unemployment Tax Act (or FUTA, I.R.C. ch. 23) is a United States federal law that imposes a federal employer tax used to help fund state workforce agencies.
